Main Course: Rice recipe: Bisi Bele BathÂ  Servings: 4Â  Duration: 45 minutesÂ  Bise Bele Bath is a spicy flavored lentils rice recipe and has unique taste originated from Karnataka. The main ingredient in this recipe isÂ Bisi Bele Bath PowderÂ , yesterday I shared the detailed recipe it has pungent essence and lovely to use homemade spice powder than store bought ones. Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Sona Masoori Rice - 3/4 th cup - 120 gms
  • Red Gram / Kandi Pappu - 1/4 th cup - 40 gms
  • Rajma / Red kidney beans - 60 gms ( soaked 12 hours)
  • Bisi Bele Bath Powder ( click for recipe)Â - 3 Tb sp
  • Potatoes - 2 - Peeled off - Diced
  • Carrot - 1 - Peeled off & chopped
  • Beans - 8 - chopped - 1 inch
  • Green peas - frozen or fresh - 60 gms
  • Onion - medium sized- finely chopped
  • Tomato ğŸ…Â - 1 - diced
  • Tamarind - lemon size - soaked in water & extract pulp
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 10
  • Hing/ Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp
  • Cashew Nuts - 20
  • Butter - 3 Tb sp
  • Cooking Oil - 1 Tb sp
  • Turmeric Powder - pinch
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Jaggery pieces - 1 inch block or 2 Tb sp
  • Water - 640 ml ( to cook rice)
Procedure: Cooking Rice, Lentils & Rajma:Â 
  • In cooking vessel add rice, red gram and Rajma, wash twice and add 640 ml water
  • In another bowl add chopped veggies, pinch of salt & turmeric powde and keep it on rice vessel.
  • I cooked them well in electric cooker. If youâ€™re cooking in pressure cooker, cook for 3 whistles and reduce water accordingly
  • Take out rice vessel and gently mix , keep aside
Process of making Bisi Bele Bath:
  • Heat a deep vessel or Heavy bottom pan over medium heat
  • Add butter & oil, let it melt
  • Next add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, Asafoetida and cashew nuts
  • Saute 2 minutes and add chopped onion. Saute 2 more minutes and add diced tomatoes ğŸ…
  • Saute & Cover with lid , let it cook 2 minutes or till it becomes mushy
  • Next add tamarind pulp,water (200 ml ) Â jaggery pieces, salt,Â Bisi Bele Bath Powder,Â Â Mix well and let it cook 5 minutes
  • Next add cooked rice, lentils, Rajma and veggies
  • Gently mix and cover with lid, let it cook over medium heat for 5 minutes
  • Open lid , gently mix and cook more 10 minutes over low heat, adjust water quantity according to your preference.
  • Serve hot with onion-tomato raita and potato ğŸ¥”Â chips
